properties.tree_description: This tree has both Inonotus and Ganoderma Fungi at the base. The tree was topped approximately 4 to 5 years ago.

Tree maybe a Red Oak. At 4.5 feet off the ground, the tree is more than 16 feet in circumference. The tree is at least 60 feet tall. Reason for Removal:Dying treeComments:The tree is unfortunately dying, and has dropped signifanct limbs which has resulted in insurance claims on 2 cars, and one of the cars was totalled. My home owner's insurance company may also drop me if the tree is not delimbed. There are many branches that have broken off and are suspended in air by other branches right over power lines. GA Power says they are unable to do anything until the limbs fall on the lines.

This maple exhibits severe basal decay, evidenced by fungal mushroom growth around the root plate. The presence of these fruiting bodies indicates advanced internal decay and root-plate deterioration. Additionally, the tree shows signs of Phytophthora canker approximately 20 feet up the main stem, further compromising structural integrity.
